body:
Hi everyone,

When I try to run the honeybee_run_daylightsimulation component, it only works when I don’t rotate the scene (see, img 1 vs 2); both when trying to rotate the scene using a vector or with a number.

I’ve attached an example file.

Looking forward to understanding what is going on?



Thanks in advance for your reply!

replies.body:
The error report states:

1. Solution exception:unsupported operand type(s) for +=: 'str' and 'bool'
[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJKPq0kvHVVEG7RD062XIBItt69dAs9i4HbYLLA6NlG0T0msuUu7ZGVdVL5MLWc4UMu6PZgnCvB8-RypD*hl7pIR9kWFJaif/Capture.JPG)You can report this at the github. -A.

Ian and Abraham,

Thanks again for bringing this to my attention.  It turns out that this was a bug that was introduced because of the new capabilities that I added into the Honeybee transform components that you suggested as a workaround, Abraham.  In any case, I fixed the bug here:

[https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/honeybee/commit/c551c322430fc0d...](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/honeybee/commit/c551c322430fc0d5f6bf9b9cbfad9a1a62cc688e)

And you can find a working file attached.

-Chris
